info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 18 at 3:52PM EDT until June 18 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Northern Indiana
info.description:
SVRIWX
The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a
* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern St. Joseph County in north central Indiana... Northern La Porte County in northwestern Indiana... Berrien County in southwestern Michigan...
* Until 430 PM EDT/330 PM CDT/.
* At 352 PM EDT/252 PM CDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Chesterton to near La Porte to near Knox, moving north at 65 mph.
HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees.
* Locations impacted include... South Bend, Michigan City, La Porte, Niles, Benton Harbor, St. Joseph, Buchanan, Trail Creek, Benton Heights, Fair Plain, Bridgman, New Buffalo, New Carlisle, Berrien Springs, Watervliet, Three Oaks, Coloma, Long Beach, Stevensville, and Roseland.
This includes the following highways... Interstate 196 between mile markers 0 and 7. Interstate 80 in Indiana between mile markers 38 and 77. Interstate 94 in Indiana between mile markers 33 and 45. Interstate 94 in Michigan between mile markers 0 and 42.
info.instruction:
For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
Large hail, damaging wind, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature's leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT/700 PM CDT/ for north central and northwestern Indiana...and southwestern Michigan.
